ieee_style.description: IEEE citation style for engineering and computer science

journal_article.format: Author, "Title," Journal, vol. X, no. Y, pp. Z-Z, Month Year.
journal_article.example: J. Smith, "Machine learning approaches," IEEE Trans. Pattern Anal. Mach. Intell., vol. 42, no. 3, pp. 123-135, Mar. 2020.

conference_paper.format: Author, "Title," in Proc. Conference, City, Country, Year, pp. Z-Z.
conference_paper.example: J. Doe, "Deep neural networks," in Proc. IEEE Conf. Computer Vision Pattern Recognition, Boston, MA, USA, 2021, pp. 1234-1242.

book.example: A. Author, Machine Learning Fundamentals. New York: McGraw-Hill, 2019.

book_chapter.format: Author, "Chapter title," in Book Title, Editor, Ed. City: Publisher, Year, pp. Z-Z.
book_chapter.example: B. Writer, "Neural networks," in AI Handbook, C. Editor, Ed. Boston: MIT Press, 2020, pp. 45-67.

website.example: OpenAI, "GPT-4 Technical Report," OpenAI. [Online]. Available: https://openai.com/research/gpt-4. [Accessed: Mar. 15, 2023].

thesis.format: Author, "Title," Ph.D./M.S. dissertation, Dept., Univ., City, Year.
thesis.example: R. Student, "Advanced machine learning techniques," Ph.D. dissertation, Dept. Computer Science, MIT, Cambridge, MA, 2021.

technical_report.format: Author, "Title," Institution, City, Tech. Rep. Number, Year.
technical_report.example: Research Team, "Survey of deep learning," Google Research, Mountain View, CA, Tech. Rep. TR-2021-01, 2021.

preprint.example: A. Researcher, "Novel neural architecture," arXiv preprint arXiv:2103.12345, 2021.

IEEE Transactions on Pattern Analysis and Machine Intelligence
IEEE Transactions on Neural Networks and Learning Systems

conferences.Proc. IEEE Conf. Computer Vision Pattern: Proceedings of IEEE Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition
Proceedings of International Conference on Machine Learning
Proceedings of Neural Information Processing Systems

acm_style.description: ACM citation style for computer science

journal_article.format: Author. Year. Title. Journal Vol, Num (Month Year), pages. DOI
journal_article.example: John Smith. 2021. Machine learning approaches to computer vision. ACM Comput. Surv. 54, 2 (March 2021), 1-35. https://doi.org/10.1145/3448341

conference_paper.format: Author. Year. Title. In Conference (Location). Pages. DOI
conference_paper.example: Jane Doe. 2021. Deep neural networks for image recognition. In CHI '21: CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems (Yokohama, Japan). 1-12. https://doi.org/10.1145/3411764.3445123

book.example: Alice Author. 2020. Fundamentals of Machine Learning. MIT Press, Cambridge, MA.

journal_article.format: Author, A. A. (Year). Title of article. Title of Journal, Volume(Issue), pages. DOI
journal_article.example: Smith, J. A. (2021). Machine learning in healthcare. Journal of Medical Informatics, 45(3), 123-135. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jmi.2021.01.001

book.format: Author, A. A. (Year). Title of book. Publisher.
book.example: Johnson, M. L. (2020). Deep learning fundamentals. Academic Press.

conference_paper.format: Author, A. A. (Year). Title of paper. In Proceedings of Conference (pp. pages). Publisher.
conference_paper.example: Brown, K. R. (2021). Neural network optimization. In Proceedings of the 2021 Conference on AI (pp. 234-241). IEEE.

journal_article.format: Author, A. A. et al. Title. Journal vol, pages (year).
journal_article.example: Smith, J. A. et al. Machine learning for drug discovery. Nature 589, 123-128 (2021).

book.example: Watson, J. D. The Double Helix (Atheneum, 1968).

common_citation_errors.fix: Choose one style and apply consistently
Add citations for all factual claims and prior work
Include all required fields for each reference type

common_citation_errors.description: Relying too heavily on old sources
common_citation_errors.fix: Include recent relevant work, typically within 5-10 years

common_citation_errors.description: Using non-academic sources for academic claims

academic_integrity: Cite all sources of ideas, even if paraphrased
Distinguish between your contributions and prior work
citation_density: Introduction: high citation density for background
Related work: very high citation density
source_quality: Use recent sources (within 5-10 years for most fields)
Include seminal/foundational papers regardless of age
Balance conference and journal papers appropriately
citation_context: Provide sufficient context for each citation
Explain how cited work relates to your research
Use signal phrases to introduce citations

computer_science.conference_importance: Conferences often more prestigious than journals
computer_science.software_citation: Cite software tools and datasets used
computer_science.reproducibility: Include implementation details and code availability

doi_usage.preference: Use DOI over URL when available

url_citations.access_dates: Include access date for web resources
url_citations.url_shorteners: Avoid shortened URLs in formal citations

preprint_handling.bioRxiv: Note if later published in journal
preprint_handling.version_tracking: Specify version number if citing preprint
